definition: theatrical work (play, opera, TV series etc)/dramatic (change, increase etc)/acute/severe
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

pinyin: xi4 ju4 hua4 ren2 ge2 wei2 chang2

sentences.chinese: 当然这个是戏剧化的情节。

sentences.english: The story became even more dramatic when Bao returned to the jury.
sentences.chinese: 这个故事变得更加戏剧化，当包小柏返回评委会时。

sentences.english: The play was a dramatization of a short story.
sentences.chinese: 那个剧本是对一个简短事故的戏剧化。

sentences.english: The most dramatic effect of argyria is that the skin becomes colored blue or bluish-grey.
sentences.chinese: 银中毒最戏剧化的效果就是皮肤变成蓝色或者蓝灰色。

sentences.english: so it's quite theatrical. So we have models dressing up in costumes
sentences.chinese: 它很戏剧化。所以，我们有穿着戏服的模特，

sentences.english: I can be shiny and I can also be dramatic and prideful.
sentences.chinese: 我是闪闪发光的，同时也是戏剧化的和高傲的。

sentences.english: Drama is a part of life, but we don’t have to wallow in it.
sentences.chinese: 生活中总有戏剧化的一面，但是没有必要总是演戏。

sentences.english: The third chapter analyses the relation between dramatization and impersonal lyricism .
sentences.chinese: 第三章分析戏剧化与“非个人化抒情”的关系。

sentences.english: What it used to be-drama free.
sentences.chinese: 我们的爱情曾经如此戏剧化。
《远走高飞》戏剧化了我们的困境。

sentences.english: He theatrically turned his head to watch a butterfly flutter by.
sentences.chinese: 他戏剧化的转头看飞过的蝴蝶。

sentences.english: It is unhealthy to dramatise life.
sentences.chinese: 生活的戏剧化是不健康的。

sentences.english: This is all that I dare to say in such a dramatic situation.
sentences.chinese: 面对如此戏剧化的情形，我也只敢说这些。

sentences.english: Genesis 2 is much more dramatic, much more earthy.
sentences.chinese: 而《创世纪》2则更加戏剧化，粗俗化。

definition: silly talk or "mo lei tau" (Cantonese), genre of humor emerging from Hong Kong late in the 20th century
to stir up emotion/to arouse sympathy/moving
the feeling that sth is genuine/sense of reality/in the flesh
to flash back/flashback (in a novel, movie etc)
